intro: Tetrapterys arcana, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with five to seven divisions, giving it a distinctive appearance. Tetrapterys arcana is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and hillside habitats.
